verses.verse: <S%H347>Job<s%> again <S%H3254>took<s%> up his <S%H4912>parable,<s%> and <S%H559>said,<s%>
"As <S%H410>God<s%> <S%H2416>lives,<s%> who has taken <S%H5493>away<s%> my <S%H4941>right,<s%> the <S%H7706>Almighty,<s%> who has made my <S%H5315>soul<s%> <S%H4843>bitter.<s%>
(For the <S%H5750>length<s%> of my <S%H5397>life<s%> is still in <S%H7307>me,<s%> and the spirit of <S%H433>God<s%> is in my <S%H639>nostrils<s%>);
surely my <S%H8193>lips<s%> shall not <S%H1696>speak<s%> <S%H5766>unrighteousness,<s%> neither shall my <S%H3956>tongue<s%> <S%H1897>utter<s%> <S%H7423>deceit.<s%>
Far be <S%H2486>it<s%> from me that I should <S%H6663>justify<s%> <S%H1478>you.<s%> Until I die I will not put <S%H5493>away<s%> my integrity from <S%H8538>me.<s%>
I <S%H2388>hold<s%> fast to my <S%H6666>righteousness,<s%> and will not let it <S%H7503>go.<s%> My <S%H3824>heart<s%> shall not <S%H2778>reproach<s%> me so long as I <S%H3117>live.<s%>
"Let my <S%H341>enemy<s%> be as the <S%H7563>wicked.<s%> Let him who rises <S%H6965>up<s%> against me be as the <S%H5767>unrighteous.<s%>
For what is the <S%H8615>hope<s%> of the <S%H2611>godless,<s%> when he is cut <S%H1214>off,<s%> when <S%H433>God<s%> takes <S%H7953>away<s%> his <S%H5315>life?<s%>
Will <S%H410>God<s%> <S%H8085>hear<s%> his <S%H6818>cry<s%> when <S%H6869>trouble<s%> comes on <S%H935>him?<s%>
Will he <S%H6026>delight<s%> himself in the <S%H7706>Almighty,<s%> and <S%H7121>call<s%> on <S%H433>God<s%> at all <S%H6256>times?<s%>
I will <S%H3384>teach<s%> you about the <S%H3027>hand<s%> of <S%H410>God.<s%> That which is with the <S%H7706>Almighty<s%> will I not <S%H3582>conceal.<s%>
<S%H2372>Behold,<s%> all of you have seen it <S%H1892>yourselves;<s%> why then have you become altogether <S%H1891>vain?<s%>

"This is the <S%H2506>portion<s%> of a <S%H7563>wicked<s%> <S%H120>man<s%> with <S%H410>God,<s%> the <S%H5159>heritage<s%> of <S%H6184>oppressors,<s%> which they <S%H3947>receive<s%> from the <S%H7706>Almighty.<s%>
If his <S%H1121>children<s%> are <S%H7235>multiplied,<s%> it is <S%H3926>for<s%> the <S%H2719>sword.<s%> His <S%H6631>offspring<s%> shall not be <S%H7646>satisfied<s%> with <S%H3899>bread.<s%>
Those who <S%H8300>remain<s%> of him shall be <S%H6912>buried<s%> in <S%H4194>death.<s%> His <S%H490>widows<s%> shall make no <S%H1058>lamentation.<s%>
Though he heap <S%H6651>up<s%> <S%H3701>silver<s%> as the <S%H6083>dust,<s%> and <S%H3559>prepare<s%> <S%H4403>clothing<s%> as the <S%H2563>clay;<s%>
he may <S%H3559>prepare<s%> <S%H6662>it,<s%> but the just shall put it <S%H3847>on,<s%> and the <S%H5355>innocent<s%> shall <S%H2505>divide<s%> the <S%H3701>silver.<s%>
He <S%H1129>builds<s%> his <S%H1004>house<s%> as the <S%H6211>moth,<s%> as a <S%H5521>booth<s%> which the <S%H5341>watchman<s%> <S%H6213>makes.<s%>
He lies <S%H7901>down<s%> <S%H6223>rich,<s%> but he shall not do so <S%H622>again.<s%> He <S%H6491>opens<s%> his <S%H5869>eyes,<s%> and he is not.
<S%H1091>Terrors<s%> <S%H5381>overtake<s%> him like <S%H4325>waters.<s%> A <S%H5492>storm<s%> steals him <S%H1589>away<s%> in the <S%H3915>night.<s%>
The <S%H6921>east<s%> wind carries him <S%H5375>away,<s%> and he <S%H3212>departs.<s%> It <S%H8175>sweeps<s%> him out of his <S%H4725>place.<s%>
For it <S%H7993>hurls<s%> at <S%H2550>him,<s%> and does not spare, as he <S%H1272>flees<s%> away from his <S%H3027>hand.<s%>
Men shall <S%H5606>clap<s%> their <S%H3709>hands<s%> at <S%H8319>him,<s%> and shall hiss him out of his <S%H4725>place.<s%>
